title: Strengthening AI Practical Skills: Data-Driven Interaction Design Strategies in Online Learning Environments

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level subject-matter expertise and problem-solving abilities
context.additional_context: Advanced AI/machine learning technical course for AI/ML practitioners

learning_goals: Learners design strategies to improve learner engagement by over 20% by analyzing interaction data (e.g., link clicks, zoom features) within online modules.

Learners will draft a design guide analyzing correlations between click-level behavioral metrics (CTR, dwell time) and assessment outcomes (test scores, completion rates) within one week. They will obtain peer review feedback scoring ≥4 on a 5-point scale.

Learners will develop a prototype of an interaction-based assessment tool executable on smartphones within one week. They will demonstrate a functional demo meeting ≥2 of 3 predefined functional requirements: user input processing, real-time feedback, and result storage.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
